question: Can I increase my mortgage if my salary has increased to $80,000 annually?
true_answer: Yes, with a salary of $80,000, you may qualify for a mortgage increase, subject to a new credit check and DTI assessment.

steps.content: Can I increase my mortgage if my salary has increased to $80,000 annually?
Plan: 1) Hand off to home_loan_agent for mortgage increase criteria. 2) Involve credit_agent for updated score. 3) Calculate new DTI. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Return answer.
Mortgage increase typically requires proof of income increase and acceptable credit score.
Checking updated credit score associated with new income.
Credit score is unchanged, still acceptable for increase.
Calculating new debt-to-income ratio with $80,000 salary.
New DTI calculated at 25%, well below the maximum threshold.
Would this process affect my current interest rate?
Retrieving information on interest rate impact.
Interest rates could be renegotiated if the mortgage amount changes.
All checks validated, process looks clear.
Yes, with a salary of $80,000, you may qualify for a mortgage increase, subject to a new credit check and DTI assessment.
Interest rate changes are possible depending on new terms.
